Description:
While waiting on the traffic light, a motorbike with two men stopped at my window and asked to give  cel phone and money. One of them has a gun and point at me.

I gave them cel phone and  all the money i have. They continue his way.
Location: traffic light ,  5th avenida / 3rd calle 2-60  , 2 blocks  north after  Rafa NAdal  Tenis Club  , Guatemala city

Description: test

the incident occurred in Talibani Compound   controlled by Peshmerga ( Kurdish Military force ) represent the presidency brigade when an lieutenant opened fire using his pistol killed University professor  near Check point  led to the intervention of Iraqi security force with the presence of Prime minister Noori Al-Maliki resulted to arrest the lieutenant and replace Peshmerga force by police to take the compound control
Location:
Talibani Compound - Jadiriyah city 
Peshmerga officer killed an university professor near Peshmerga Check point

Description:
Fredrick Wambuya wasdriving on Mbita – Homa Bay road which is still under construction at approximately 70Km/hr. He approached a bend and slowed to approximately 50-60km/h. On completion of the bend he felt the car sway from side to side then it veered to the left of the road hitting an embankment. This made the car overturn once to the right.

Approximately fifteen minutes after the accident I reported to the Kenya Police and Richard Onyancha the Nyanza Regional Manager who later reported to George Tenge the Operations Manager. The Operations manager then sent out mail to J.D. Crouch, Michael Bowers Dave Algoso and Patrick Wandabusi. 

Both Fredrick Wambuya and Effie Awuor sought medical attention from Mbita District Hospital and series of tests were carried out. From the hospital tests there were no injuries of serious concerns.
Location: MBITA, MBITA DISTRICT IN HOMA BAY COUNTY

Description: Restricted movement due to demonstration against EU-LEX
Theft of one laptop from Osterode camp office. No door or lock was broken.
Security Guards in Osterode closed gate and do not let Mercy Corps access to camp. They are asking for raises in salaries. MC Hired company SOKO to manage security in Osterode

Confrontation between Kosovo Police Services and Local Residents in barricade in Zupce. Local Residents tried to prevent KPS to send Custom Officers to border crossing. Confrontation resulted with one KPS officer death and about 11 Local residents injured.

Government of Kosovo send Customs Officers in cross bordering point Jarinje. Demonstrations occurred and cross border point is burned by Local Residents. Confirmed rubber bullet shooting and tear gas.

Government of Kosovo send Customs Officers in cross bordering point Jarinje. Demonstrations occurred and cross border point is burned by Local Residents. Confirmed rubber bullet shooting and tear gas.
Group of local people asked MC Staff to stop the already started Information session for businesses. The sessions is stopped 15 minutes after start
Mercy Corps changed Security Alert Level from Green to Yellow and distributed information with staff and GSA

KFOR started removing barricades (5.40h) in direction to Brnjak cross bordering. Local Serbs from all cities of northern region in Jagnjenica (in the barricade). KFOR launched tear gas. Medias are reporting 30 injuries from gas (22 local Serbs and 8 KFOR soldiers)
Program Officer was asked to pick up a permit from police to enter Palestinian camps, he was detained by authorities for 24 hours.
The main electric switchboard caused fire in the building where MC office is located.MC staff were evacuated
A bus accident in Fleisa between Same and Maubisee, the Manufahi SECURE District Coordinator was on board. 3 people were killed but luckily the MC staff member escaped with minor injuries

The Country Director was driving in Dili town in heavy traffic. A police vehilcle ran into the back of the MC car knocking the MC car into the taxi. No demage to MC vehicle and there was only little demage to the taxi. Front of police car was badly damaged. Policeman accepted full responsibility
A threateaning by a drunk person against MC E4A coordinator in Dili-Villa Verde when she conducted baseline survey. The survey was suspended for a day
A E4A district coordinator got in a motor bike accident in Ainaro. Minor injury
A standing motor bike of MC staff(commnity mobilizer) was hit by a truck at the time he was photocopying some docs in the market
A Laptop and Mobile along with some other stuff were stolen from MC finance officer's Car in the market
A motor bike of MC community Mobilizer was theft in front of his house by unknown, Police complaint was registered.
Four of MC staff members were kidnapped, in result one staff member(driver)was killed and three later released. Over all programs were suspended.
The Sub-grant compliance officer slipped from the boat when she was trying to get off from the boat at the jetty, she got injury on her leg.

On the field vist by a senior program advisor, he slipped on the boat floor when he was trying to get down on the boat. He got injured on his nose, eyes, knee and shoulder as banged against the wooden door frame of the boat.
There were a fire burning inside the Finance Officer's staff house room while she was away, one bed and a laptop (personal) was seared and damaged.
5 sports kits were stolen at warehouse
Earthquake happens, Chengdu office sets up.
Religion Conflict in Ambon Maluku, Ojek driver was killed from motor accident, the rumor spread out that he was murder by Christian communities, 8 people death many house burn out
Female worker come back from her office abducted in the public transportation, robbed and raped
Female Student got abducted in the public transportation during the day, Killed and raped, her body dump outside the city
Staff lost their cell phone on public transportation (pickup pocket)
Staff work in Buru Island Maluku, He got Malaria
Staff sent for Emergency Respond in Mentawai, She Got Cikunguya disease
Staff on going to the project field, the car front left wheel  felt off, Car Flipped in Toll Road, 6 injured, 1 serious injure
Riot and Gang fighting in front of court building on ampere street (1,5 km from office), 2 was killed and several injuries
10 armed young men attempted to conduct a camel raid. At the time, our PLI II was conducted a vaccination campaign
The logistics officer was traveling from Kurmuk to Damazin on local transportation due to lack of vehicles. He was detained by SPLA for 24 hrs.
Two men broke into a staff residence in NBO,
Al-Shabab bans three aid groups in Somalia South central including MC.
Unloaded rental truck The truck came under fire from unidentified armed men.
Shooting  in Degahbour, one bullet hit the MC compound.
Rental truck overturned and killed 3 and injured 5 ''illegal'' passengers
Mercy Corps International staff were detained for two hours and threatened by the SPLA-DC in Upper Nile en route to Melut.
Personnel valuables stolen, driver and staff beaten near Kitchanga
Car accident in Banbari; driver injured and car damaged
Fighting among elements of the SAF-JIU elements in Malakal constraining the MC team to hibernate for three days.
A conflict between a Police and a JIU soldier in the market was the cause of the shooting. MC staff was force to relocate to Agok
A truck was driving on the wrong side of the road at high speed around a sharp ben, the driver lost control of the vehicle and rolled three times.
Three MC laptops and money were stolen at the Sudan guest house, after one of the staff resident brought two prostitutes in the properties
At 11.45, unidentified gunmen stopped a MC vehicle at Kashuga location and stole 270 USD from the driver and the wash PM
The nutrition team was shot at while passing through Gashamo kebele. No one was injured though a bullet hit the driver’s back seat.
FDLR attacked a military position at 13.20 in Kikuku. MC Staff  working in the IDP camp run away and took cover
Three vehicles in convoy were attacked at 16:50 at JTN before Nyanzal. Some staff were beaten up and monthly cash flow robbed.
At 22:30 in Bentiu, the UK OPS was taken from his hotel in Bentiu by three agents from the NI.He was questioned for about 1 hour.
SPLA attacked the militia who took control of Mankien. Before the re-capture, militia entered our compound and stole a laptop and bicycle.
In Mankien, SPLA soldiers beat two staff and stole valuable. The staff sustained minor injuries to the body and head and were released.
Challenges World Wide intern with Mercy Corps Uganda, died at Kotido Health Center 4 at approximately 19:50 hours, May 24, 2011
Two  MC vehicles were attacked and personal belongings stolen  in Mutwangano South of Nyanzale, in Rutshuru territory
Fighting between SAF & SPLA erupted in Kadugli, on 7 June 3 MC staff were evacuated with 250 other NGO staff to the UNMIS compound.
